main event: On April 19, 1952, in Benton, Pennsylvania, radar operators observed three unconventional aircraft flying in formation at an altitude of approximately 12,000 feet for a duration of 28 minutes.
interesting points: The aircraft were initially considered friendly and did not prompt any immediate tactical response.
Ground observations were classified, indicating potential additional information about the sighting.
The target was picked up by radar and appeared on the IFF scope for 25-30 minutes, suggesting prolonged observation.
Radar observations were made on the track of the object, adding to the credibility of the report.
The report was declassified and released in full on September 11, 1985, adding to its historical significance.
sighted object: three unconventional aircraft flying in formation
